results.title: Australian diary. No. 007
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: British migrants are welcomed to their new homes; in particular tradespeople arriving in Australia. Australian designers show their talents by designing garments in local wool and cotton and parading them in a Sydney department store. Ex-servicemen and women form a musical society - Melbourne services Commemoration Musical Society. Nicotine sulphate made fromplants grown in Victoria is extracted by scientists to form an insecticide to protect other plants. Surf Life Saving Clubs from around Australia compete at the national Cahmpionships held in Southport, Queensland.

results.brief_description: This cinemagazine features the following items: swimming instruction classes in New South Wales; problems with traffic in Melbourne; Aborigines show their skill with the stockwhip; Sulman architectural awards and strange animals at the Melbourne Zoo.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 003 (A)
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: a look at a Brisbane creche; Spanish monks and nuns teach Aboriginal children at New Norcia, a mission in Western Australia; families shown mining mica at Harts Range in the Northern terrotory and a Victorian fashion parade as models exhibit the latest styles in woollen clothing.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 002
results.brief_description: This diary features Kauri timber in Western Australia, Sydney from the air - how it looks from four miles up, a motor yacht regatta, Kingaroy’s peanut industry, ‘Bernborough’ winning the Doomben race, and spring at Mt. Kosciusko. No credits available.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 001
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: The following itms are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: seventy 16 footer class yachts race on Sydney Harbour; cattle being sold at Wodonga after travelling on the hoof; pineapple harvesting in Queensland; an expert and his children demonstrate boomerang throwing; the University of Western Australia and St. George’s College are shown; surfriding on huge seas at Manly is shown.

results.title: Australian Defence Scientific Service: 1969 report
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Malcolm Otton and John Carter
results.brief_description: The Australian Defence Scientific Service undertakes research in various fields. In the laboratories of the Weapons Research Establishment and other Commonwealth scientific areas, shows the research in thin film optics, and high-speed photography in the testing of explosives and munitions.

results.title: Australian Defence Scientific Service: 1968 film report
results.brief_description: The Australian Defence Scientific Service of the Department of Supply carries out an extensive programme of research into a variety of scientific disciplines. Work currently being carried out is an investigation of the laser, and its applications and the development of new techniques in the manufacture of micro-circuit systems. Gives a brief account of the present state of research in these fields. No other credits available.

results.title: Australian defence feature
results.creator_credit: Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations and Greg Parry
results.brief_description: Three magazine-type features that have been put together to make this 24 minute film. The first segment titled ‘Cat and Arrest’ shows the training and the initial landing of Navy Skyhawk pilots on the aircraft carrier HMAS Melbourne. The second ‘On Target’ shows the clearance of potentially explosive ordnance from the Evans Head bombing range under an Air Force program while the third item ‘Rescue 036’ shows the ‘rescue’ of a pilot after a simulated helicopter crash near the Army Aviation Centre at Oakley in Queensland.
